reviewText:
What's good: Lots, really. Music is rich, varied, and moving, if a bit abstract at times. Staging is beautifully put together, with a serious less-is-more esthetic and a few truly evocative passages. (Not sure what they evoke, but they're evocative as all get-out.) The dancers, most especially the moon princess herself, are wonderfully athletic - but she has control of her body that outstrips the others by far.

What's not: Well, nothing, maybe, depending on how much you understand the language of dance. Sad to say, I don't. I watch this pageant with much the same interest and awe with which I might watch an ostrich's mating dance. It's rich and deep with meaning, but only lady ostriches can appreciate it fully.

Not being a dance insider (or lady ostrich), I can appreciate only small parts of this, and probably not what I was meant to. What I grok, I like well enough, but the largest part of its meaning lies hidden within its inscrutable idiom. Without the liner notes, the dance would have had all the narrative clarity of a Jackson Pollock painting. Others, of course, will differ in their readings.

-- wiredweird, whom at least gave it a shot.

Kaguyahime - The Moon Princess - Nederlands Dans Theater has yet to be delivered. I have been told to wait until May 10th or so before notifying you. Please do the needful!!

Donald Kelman

Kaguyahime is an ancient Japanese fairy tale, elements of all types are found in oriental legend. The fantastic, the supernatural and the real present at the Princess of the Moon adventures of all types and models are part of the tale, a junction where elmentos natural earth and moon interact with humans. Everyone wants to marry the beautiful princess, but no one has that right. Princes die along the way, kings are dispensed and a series of machinations happens. Kaguyahime is the princess of the impossible, shows the diversity of the people nipnico, the fight to win. An interesting tale, full of mysteries connected directly to the culture and Japanese way of thinking. The choreographer Jiri Kylian takes the story of the mysterious princess and turns it into a full ballet. His narrative is not linear, it turns into a Kaguyahime complexity of movements and styles. Steps significant, rapid and long are the highlight of her dance. The abstract is present, experimentation and innovation are part of the work of the choreographer. Efficiently uses the light, and it changes settings quickly through the game of colors and effects. Dancers dialogue with the scenarios, unite them in a mix traditional and modern. Cars, huge Japanese drums, a profusion of colors and different scenes. Kylin not let the viewer's life easier, play the scenes of incomprehensible way, and if you do not know the legend, even watch the entire ballet will go on without knowing it. If you want easy, watch the soap opera of the Globe.
  The music is by composer Maki Ishii, using oriental instruments and elements in their composition. Drums and flutes and even the Gagaku are present. Music blaring, it bothers his ears and nonsensical. It sounds more modern than the works of Schoenberg, but follows the course of the choreography. Choreographer and composer spoke the same language. Is understood to show a complex and difficult to assimilate.
  Released in Brazil by the collection The Best of Ballet, will be relaunched in October Kaguyahime the international market. I prefer the linear track, the beautiful melody, the classic and romantic ballet. I get my Giselle, my Swan Lake, Paquita and my my Sleeping Beauty.

Portuguese:Original Language

Kaguyahime  um antigo  conto de fadas japons;  elementos de todos os tipos se encontram na lenda oriental. O fantstico, o sobrenatural e o real se apresentam na princesa da Lua. Peripcias de todos os tipos e modelos fazem parte do conto, uma juno de elmentos naturais onde terra e lua interagem com seres humanos. Todos querem casar com a bela princesa, mas ningum tem esse direito. Prncipes falecem no meio do caminho, reis so dispensados e toda uma srie de maquinaes acontece. Kaguyahime  a prncesa do impossvel, mostra a diversidade do povo nipnico, do lutar para ganhar. Uma lenda interessante, cheia de mistrios ligados diretamente  cultura e ao modo de pensar japons.  O coregrafo Jir Kylin aproveita a histria da misteriosa princesa e a transforma em um bal completo. Sua narrativa no  linear, ele transforma Kaguyahime em uma complexidade de movimentos e cores. Passos expressivos, rpidos e longos so a tnica de sua dana. O abstrato est presente, a experimentao e  a inovao fazem parte do trabalho do coregrafo. Utiliza de maneira eficiente a luz, e com ela altera cenrios rapidamente atravs do jogo de cores e efeitos.  Danarinos  dialogam com os cenrios, unem-se a eles em uma mistura moderna e tradicional. Carros , enormes tambores japoneses, uma profuso de cores e diversas cenas. Kylin no deixa a vida do espectador fcil, joga as cenas de maneira incompreensvel, e,  se voc no conhece a lenda,  ainda que  assista ao bal todo vai continuar sem conhec-la. Se quer moleza,  assista  novela da Globo.
  A msica  do compositor Maki Ishii, que usa elementos e instrumentos orientais em sua composio. Tambores e flautas e at o Gagaku esto presentes. Msica estridente, que incomoda os ouvidos e sem nexo. Soa mais moderna que as obras de Schoenberg, mas acompanha o desenrolar da coreografia. Coregrafo e compositor falaram a mesma lngua. Se entenderam ao mostrar um trabalho complexo e de difcil assimilao.
  Lanado no Brasil pela coleo O melhor do Bal, Kaguyahime ser relanada em Outubro no mercado internacional. Eu prefiro a msica linear, a bela melodia, o bal clssico e romntico. Fico com minha Giselle, meu Lago dos Cisnes, minha Paquita e minha Bela Adormecida.

Fiona Lumis (Kaguyahime) is an amazing dancer. I was mesmerized! If she has a fan club, I want to join!

This is a very artistic and incredibly danced work by Jiri Kylian.  It is slow, like Kabuki or Noh theatre from Japan, but oh so worth it.  Beautiful design, lighting, and sensitivity to the Japanese art forms.  Thank you.

This is by far one of the most impressive piece of work by NDT choregraphed by Jiri Kylian. They made supreme work on combining all area : dance, music, staging, lighting. The performance seems to have been recorded a little while ago (not very recent), which I can guess from less colorful recording, however, due to such style of recording, it can make you to see more of the dance. The dancers on this one are the best ones from NDT, and highly recommend this work. Really happy to own this work.
